Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Gestational Hypertension on Offspring Seizure Risk

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed at the cohort level

Participants.evidence: Participants were children born to mothers with or without GH

Intervention.evidence: Participants were children born to mothers with or without GH

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the association between GH and seizure risk in children.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of seizures in offspring, measured up to 18 years of age.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed at the cohort level, and allocation was concealed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: children of mothers with GH had a higher seizure incidence (OR 1.22; 95% CI: 1.21â€“1.23, P < 0.001)
